title: Panna Cotta
description: Easy to make yet heavenly delicious
story:
I still can not believe how easy it is to make Panna Cotta.

Most instructions call to heat cream and milk, I have a slightly different technique wich makes Panna Cotta light and fluffy
instructions: Dissolve gelatine in 50ml of warm milk.
Add sugar to the rest of milk, whisk and start warming it up on a low heat.
Cut open vanilla bean and scrape seeds. Add vanilla seeds together with empty bean into the heating milk.
Once milk is almost boiling, add dissolved gelatine, take off the heat, mix very well.
Pour the mixture through strainer into the bowl, set aside to cool down.
Whip heavy cream until soft peaks form.
Gently incorporate whipped cream into cooled milk mixture.
Pour into small cups or ramekins. Refrigerate for at least 3-4 hours or overnight. I make 6 cups of Panna Cotta from this amount of ingredients.
To take Panna Cotta from ramekins, you may want to put ramekin into a bowl of warm water for a moment and run a knife around the edge.
For berries sauce: take 2/3 of your berries (rest 1/3 set aside for later use). Squeeze lemon juice, add powdered sugar.
On a low heat cook berries until they start boiling. Take off the heat, pure using hand blender.
Process through strainer to get rid off seeds. Add the rest of berries to the smooth jam.
Cool down before serving with Panna Cotta.
